de.javasoft.swing
Class JYTableScrollPane

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JScrollPane
                  de.javasoft.swing.JYTableScrollPane
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.ScrollPaneConstants
public class JYTableScrollPane
extends javax.swing.JScrollPane

Enhanced JScrollPane which handles ColumnSubHeaders and UpperSubCorners.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

JYTableScrollPane

public JYTableScrollPane()
Creates an empty (no viewport view) JYTableScrollPane where both horizontal and vertical scrollbars appear when needed.

JYTableScrollPane

public JYTableScrollPane(java.awt.Component view,
                         int vsbPolicy,
                         int hsbPolicy)
Creates a JYTableScrollPane that displays the view component in a viewport whose view position can be controlled with a pair of scrollbars. The scrollbar policies specify when the scrollbars are displayed, For example, if vsbPolicy is VERTICAL_SCROLLBAR_AS_NEEDED then the vertical scrollbar only appears if the view doesn't fit vertically. The available policy settings are listed at JScrollPane.setVerticalScrollBarPolicy(int) and JScrollPane.setHorizontalScrollBarPolicy(int).

Parameters:
view - the component to display in the scrollpanes viewport
vsbPolicy - an integer that specifies the vertical scrollbar policy
hsbPolicy - an integer that specifies the horizontal scrollbar policy
See Also:
JScrollPane.setViewportView(java.awt.Component)

JYTableScrollPane

public JYTableScrollPane(java.awt.Component view)
Creates a JYTableScrollPane that displays the contents of the specified component, where both horizontal and vertical scrollbars appear whenever the component's contents are larger than the view.

Parameters:
view - the component to display in the scrollpane's viewport
See Also:
JScrollPane.setViewportView(java.awt.Component)

JYTableScrollPane

public JYTableScrollPane(int vsbPolicy,
                         int hsbPolicy)
Creates an empty (no viewport view) JYTableScrollPane with specified scrollbar policies. The available policy settings are listed at JScrollPane.setVerticalScrollBarPolicy(int) and JScrollPane.setHorizontalScrollBarPolicy(int).

Parameters:
vsbPolicy - an integer that specifies the vertical scrollbar policy
hsbPolicy - an integer that specifies the horizontal scrollbar policy
See Also:
JScrollPane.setViewportView(java.awt.Component)
Method Detail

updateUI

public void updateUI()
Overrides:
updateUI in class javax.swing.JScrollPane

addColumnSubHeaderView

public void addColumnSubHeaderView(java.awt.Component view,
                                   java.awt.Component corner)
Adds a column subheader and its corner to the end of subheaders. The corner component may be null, if so the default corner component provided by the LAF is added.

Parameters:
view - the component to add as subHeader, must not be null.
corner - the component to add in the trailing corner, may be null to show a placeholder if available.

removeColumnSubHeaderView

public void removeColumnSubHeaderView(java.awt.Component view)
Removes the subheader which contains the given view and its corresponding corner component. Does nothing if there is no subheader containing the view.

Parameters:
view - the view to remove, must not be null;

getColumnSubHeaderViews

public java.util.List<java.awt.Component> getColumnSubHeaderViews()
Returns a list of the added subheaders, guaranteed to be never null.

Returns:
a list of the contained subHeaders, guaranteed to be never null

getColumnSubHeaderCount

public int getColumnSubHeaderCount()
Returns the number of sub headers.

Returns:
the number of sub headers.
